definition: station/to stand/to halt/to stop/branch of a company or organization/website
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: As a Bodhisattva, he would usually be standing, and dressed in jewels.
sentences.chinese: 作为一位菩萨，他通常是站立着，穿戴着宝石。

sentences.english: Stand up straight, don't lean on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 站立要端正，不可靠墙而立。

sentences.english: Lunge into the side angle pose with this standing yoga position.
sentences.chinese: 到一边角度提出这个弓步站立瑜伽立场。

sentences.english: Mary duplicated her mother's way of standing with her hands in her pockets.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽模仿她母亲两手插入口袋站立的样子。

sentences.english: Hearken unto this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.
sentences.chinese: 约伯阿，你要留心听，要站立思想神奇妙的作为。

sentences.english: Elbows have no tendency to turn in or out when standing or gaiting .
sentences.chinese: 站立时或行走中，肘部没有向内弯或向外翻的迹象。

sentences.english: The apartment flag is gold lion rampant on a field of azure.
sentences.chinese: 公寓旗帜是一头在天蓝色背景下两腿站立的狮子。

sentences.english: You can also perform calf raises on a step.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以在台阶上做站立提踵。

sentences.english: On both sides of the seat were armrests , with a lion standing beside each of them.
sentences.chinese: 宝座两旁有扶手，靠近扶手有两个狮子站立。

sentences.english: The stability of standing and self-excited swing is discussed as example.
sentences.chinese: 以人体的站立稳定性和自激摆动为例。

sentences.english: Stand in Tadasana, hands on hips.
sentences.chinese: 山式站立，双手放在髋部。

sentences.english: Thrice they passed Unsullied guards, standing as if they had been carved from stone.
sentences.chinese: 有三次他们路过无垢者守卫，他们像石雕般站立着。

sentences.english: A basic fireworks safety rule is to remain standing when using sparklers.
sentences.chinese: 烟花爆竹安全的一个基本规则是站立时，使用烟火。

sentences.english: Across the borders that divide forests of stone standing petrified.
sentences.chinese: 横跨把森林分开的站立的石头界碑。

sentences.english: We always stand when the National Anthem is played in deference to the Queen.
sentences.chinese: 奏国歌时我们总是站立着，以此表示对女王的敬意。

sentences.english: The instinctive response to being approached rapidly is to freeze.
sentences.chinese: 当有东西急速靠近时人的本能反应是马上站立不动。

definition: to land/to touch the ground/also pr. [zhuo2 di4]
to hang in the air/suspended in midair/(fig.) uncertain
